value.name: Welsh Labour leadership election: Difference without division?
value.description: Labour’s leadership election rules have changed a lot from the days when trades unions welded block votes - when Unite backed Vaughan Gething last week it was welcome support for his campaign, but individual members can vote for whomever they choose.

value.name: South Carolina primary tests Biden support with Black voters
value.description: South Carolina has not backed a Democrat for president in the general election since 1976. But because Black people make up more than half of the Democratic electorate in this southern state, it is an important test of Biden's appeal with a voting base that supports Democrats nine-to-one in presidential races.

value.name: ‘No-one, especially the Tories, is laughing at us now,’ says Reform leader
value.description: In an interview with i, the Reform Party leader says his 'medium-term' plan to take the Tories' place as the threat from the right to Labour

value.name: South Carolina 2024 Democratic primary results
value.description: Trump won the state in the 2020 general election, with 55% of the vote. Republican officials in the state voted in 2019 to cancel their presidential nominating contest in 2020, virtually paving a smooth pathway to the nomination for Trump. Trump also won ...

value.name: EDITORIAL: Voting is a right; use it
value.description: Voting is a right provided by our Founding Fathers and secured with the sacrifice of the many men and women of our military. It is not something to be taken lightly. Voters in Muskogee have an opportunity to show their patriotism and love of country by voting in upcoming municipal elections.

value.name: Sir Bob Neill: Former Tory minister to stand down at next general election
value.description: A former Tory minister has announced he will stand down as an MP at the next election to spend more time with his wife, who has suffered a stroke. Sir Bob Neill, 71, was first elected in 2006, and served as a junior minister in the coalition government.

value.name: Tory MP 'will fight for every single vote'
value.description: The Conservative candidate for the newly created Honiton and Sidmouth seat, Simon Jupp, says he will be "fighting for every single vote" at the next general election. Both have small majorities. Richard Foord won a by-election by 6,144 votes after the ...

value.name: Frances Barber: I thought I’d be lounging on a yacht by this age
value.description: T he actress Frances Barber is talking to me from her fabulous loft in Clerkenwell, central London. It’s 10.30am. “I’m actually still in bed,” she says with a throaty chuc

value.name: Fani Willis Admits Relationship With Trump Georgia Case Prosecutor She Appointed
value.description: The Fulton County district attorney denies her “personal relationship” with prosecutor Nathan Wade had any impact on the case.

value.name: General election 2024: polls show history is not on Tories’ side
value.description: With the Tories trailing Labour by about 20 points, a study of polling records going back to 1951 reveals that no government has successfully closed such a large gap this close to a general elec­tion.

value.name: Tory chairman Michael Ancram to retire
value.description: In his letter to constituency chairman Ken Carter, Mr Ancram said: “It is with genuine sadness that I have decided to stand down from Parliament at the coming general election. This decision has been forced upon me by considerations of health.

value.name: 2024 South Carolina Democratic primary: Full results
value.description: Live, town-by-town presidential election results from the 2024 New Hampshire primary. It’s the former president’s second victory in a row after winning last week’s Iowa caucuses. The former president scored another win in his bid for the GOP nomination, but Haley vowed to stay in the race.

value.name: Attorney General Merrick Garland resumes duties following ‘minimally invasive back procedure’
value.description: Attorney General Merrick Garland has resumed his official duties after undergoing a “minimally invasive back procedure” Saturday, according to a Department of Justice spokesperson.

value.name: South Carolina primary: Can Joe Biden gain momentum with victory?

value.name: Democrats hold vast fundraising advantage as Republicans face cash problems, disarray in crucial swing states
value.description: The DNC has achieved a significant fundraising head start over the RNC to start the 2024 election year, as the GOP deals with disarray in some of its swing state parties.

value.name: Biden looks for big win as voters head to polls in South Carolina primary
value.description: Voters in South Carolina headed to the polls Saturday to cast the first official votes in the Democratic presidential nominating contest, registering their preferences in a primary that President Biden is widely expected to win easily.

value.name: Ohio Attorney General given until Monday to explain rejection of voting rights amendment to court
value.description: The Ohio Supreme Court has given Republican Attorney General Dave Yost until Monday to respond to the legal claims of the coalition of civil rights organizations that is challenging his rejection of a package of proposed voter protections they are working to place on November's ballot.

value.name: Labour vetoes ex-Barclays chief for net zero job after diversity row
value.description: Party claims shortlist of six to be climate watchdog boss ‘lacks credibility’, meaning process could be re-run after general election

value.name: South Carolina primary: Joe Biden hopes for big win in Democrat’s first election
value.description: President Joe Biden is hoping for a big win in South Carolina today as voters head to the poll to vote in the first official primary. Mr Biden is expected to win over his political rivals: Representative Dean Phillips and self-help author Marianne Williamson. But by how much is the question.

value.description: Plans to reform social care and House of Lords are trimmed as Keir Starmer’s party opts for caution ahead of vote

value.name: Biden looks for a big win in South Carolina's Democratic primary after pushing for state to go first
value.description: President Joe Biden is looking for an easy victory Saturday in South Carolina´s Democratic primary that officially kicks off his party's nominating process.

value.name: Many Democrats blame Biden for border chaos as issue threatens to cost him votes
value.description: While no draft has yet been released, it has been described as one of the most restrictive border bills in a century: likely to expand expulsion powers, raise the bar for asylum claims and shut down the border altogether when a daily threshold is exceeded.

value.name: US election 2024: Joe Biden hopes to win big as Democrats hold first presidential primary in South Carolina
value.description: US President Joe Biden is looking for an easy victory in the South Carolina’s Democratic primary that officially kicked off the party's presidential nomination process.

value.name: Rishi Sunak 'should learn from Labour' and stamp out Liz Truss' party within a party
value.description: Ms Truss, who was the least popular British Prime Minister since records began, will launch a group named “Popular Conservatism” this week

value.name: The sting of losing an election hurts worse when it comes as a big surprise
value.description: We’ll find out this year if new research is borne out by reality when Britain and America go to the polls

value.name: Pro-Trump and anti-Trump Republicans agree on one thing: He will be the nominee
value.description: The consensus at the 2024 Republican National Committee winter meeting in Las Vegas this week was clear among the pro-Trump and anti-Trump factions alike : Donald Trump will be the party’s presidential nominee this year.

value.name: Some Democrats Want To Help Nikki Haley As A Way To Mess With Trump
value.description: "Haley isn’t someone who will inspire an insurrection or who would deny the election," said a Democrat leading a campaign to get crossover votes for Haley.

value.name: DAN HODGES: Could Gaza and the shadow of George Galloway prompt Rishi into a snap election?
value.description: The Tory MP leapt up and did a jig of joy around the House of Commons Strangers' Bar. 'Really? That's been confirmed?' he asked. 'Is George Galloway standing in Rochdale?'

value.name: Kamala Harris Bolsters Biden for 2024 and Lays Groundwork for 2028
value.description: Stumping for the president ahead of South Carolina’s Democratic primary, Ms. Harris has been working to shore up his vulnerabilities with Black voters and younger voters.

value.name: SC’s Nikki Haley betting big on her home state in primary fight vs. Trump. Will it work?
value.description: Haley trails Trump in South Carolina in Republican primary polls by a margin of 32.1% to 62.7%, according to FiveThirtyEight’s polling averages. In national primary polls, Trump’s lead is even bigger: 72.2% to Haley’s 17.3%, per FiveThirtyEight.

value.name: Imran Khan: Pakistan ex-PM and wife Bushra Bibi jailed for illegal marriage
value.description: A Pakistani court has jailed Imran Khan and his wife for seven years after voiding their marriage, in the latest sentence against the ex-prime minister. The court ruled that Khan's 2018 marriage with Bushra Bibi, a faith healer, was un-Islamic and illegal.

value.name: Can Trump be on the ballot? It's the Supreme Court's biggest election test since Bush v. Gore
value.description: A case with the potential to disrupt Donald Trump’s drive to return to the White House is putting the Supreme Court uncomfortably at the center of the 2024 presidential campaign

about.name: Supreme Court of the United States

value.name: Last chance to register as South Africa awaits election date
value.description: South African politicians were trying to mobilise their supporters on Saturday, the last chance for citizens to register to vote before an imminent announcement of general elections.The general election must be held within 90 days of the end of Ramaphosa's term in May,

value.name: Pakistan’s Imran Khan, wife now get 7 years jail for marriage law violation
value.description: Verdict follows another case in which Khan and Bushra Bibi were sentenced to 14 years in prison for corruption.

video.name: Pakistan’s Imran Khan, wife now get 7 years jail for marriage law violation

value.name: The Polling ‘Disaster’ That’s Starting To Terrify Team Trump
value.description: In a number of national and state polls, this variable — whether Trump is criminally convicted — puts what has been a moderate Trump lead in peril. For several months, this trend has continued to appear in a variety of high-quality polls, both public and private, including as recently as this week .

value.name: President Biden to visit Las Vegas for campaign event on election stakes Sunday

The campaign event will be in Las Vegas’ historic Westside, an area where black citizens created their own casinos and clubs about 100 years ago because of segregation barring them from most establishments in the gambling mecca.

value.name: Welcome to Texas, where we dominate elections even without being a swing state | Opinion
value.description: Texas is headed for sleepy, anticlimactic presidential primaries. And no one expects Texas to be a Trump-Biden battleground.

value.description: A former Tory minister has announced he will stand down as an MP at the next election to spend more time with his wife, who has suffered a stroke. Sir Bob Neill, 71, was first elected in 2006, and served as a junior minister in the coalition government.

value.name: Frances Barber: I thought I’d be lounging on a yacht by this age
value.description: T he actress Frances Barber is talking to me from her fabulous loft in Clerkenwell, central London. It’s 10.30am. “I’m actually still in bed,” she says with a throaty chuc

value.name: General election 2024: polls show history is not on Tories’ side
value.description: With the Tories trailing Labour by about 20 points, a study of polling records going back to 1951 reveals that no government has successfully closed such a large gap this close to a general elec­tion.
